name: 12 Pool Rush
description: An aggressive early game Zerg strategy using fast Zerglings from a 12 supply Spawning Pool to catch the opponent off guard.

name: 2-1-1 Stim Timing
description: A Terran push with two Medivacs and Stimpack around 5:30 to pressure a Zerg before they can safely drone.

name: 4 Base Macro Focus
description: Focusing on production, expansions, and economy while minimizing unnecessary engagements.

name: All-In Timing
description: A push where the player commits all resources to one timing attack, often without a fallback economy.

name: Baneling Bust
description: Using Banelings to break through a wall-off or fortified entrance, typically to allow Zerglings to flood in early. Common against Terran or Protoss to punish greedy builds or lack of wall defenses.

name: Baneling Drops
description: Dropping Banelings into mineral lines to catch workers off guard and deal significant damage.

name: Burrowed Roach Ambush
description: Using hidden units to surprise your opponent, creating panic and overreaction.

name: Cannon Rush Meta
description: A commonly used strategy on ladder where players attempt to win early using proxy Photon Cannons.

name: Creep Spread
description: Spreading Creep Tumors to gain vision, speed up unit movement, and control the map.

name: Disruptor Shots
description: Using Disruptors effectively to zone out enemy units and deal massive area damage.

name: Faking Pressure
description: Pretending to commit to an attack to force a reaction or scout information.

name: Fast Expand
description: Expanding quickly to a second base in order to boost economy and tech faster.

name: High Ground Advantage
description: Taking fights from the high ground to gain vision and defensive advantages.

name: Hydra to Lurker Transition
description: Teching from Hydralisks into Lurkers for late-game defense and positional strength.

name: Inject Management
description: Maintaining regular Queen injects to ensure larva production and stable economy.

name: Ling Flood
description: Mass producing Zerglings to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

name: Ling-Bane into Muta
description: Adjusting into Mutalisks after seeing the opponent overcommit to ground anti-light units.

name: Marine Split
description: Manually spreading Marines during fights to reduce splash damage from Banelings or Psionic Storm.

name: Overlord Sacrifice
description: Sending an Overlord into the enemy base to scout tech paths at the cost of losing it.

name: Prism Micro
description: Using Warp Prisms to pick up and drop units mid-fight to extend their lifespan and efficiency.

name: Proxy Hatchery
description: Building a Hatchery in the opponent's base or near their expansion to produce units and apply pressure.

name: Roach Ravager Composition
description: A mid-game Zerg composition utilizing Roaches and Ravagers for strong pushes and zone control.

name: Roach Ravager Push
description: A mid-game push using Roaches and Ravagers to apply pressure and potentially end the game.

name: Standard ZvT Build Order
description: A safe and economic Zerg build for defending early pressure and transitioning into a mid-game army.

name: Stim Push
description: Using Stimmed bio units to put pressure on the opponent before their army is complete.

name: Wall-Off at the Ramp
description: Using buildings to block choke points and defend against early rushes.

name: Watchtower Control
description: Maintaining vision over key areas of the map using Xel'Naga Watchtowers.

name: Widow Mine Drop
description: Dropping Widow Mines in mineral lines to force reactions and deny mining.

name: Zergling Run-By
description: Using Zerglings to attack enemy mineral lines or bases while the main armies are engaged elsewhere.
